PROBLEM.TITLE: Default Lab Setup
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Mike Karabinos
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Contains the species, reactions, and solutions used by the Default Stockroom of the Virtual Lab.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Step by Step Demonstration
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Emma Rehm
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: An introductory walkthrough detailing some of the most commonly used features of the Virtual Lab.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Dilution Problem 1
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Dave Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Dilution of a glucose solution.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Dilution Problem 2
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Mike Karabinos
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Preparation of a stock solution from a concentrated acid.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Sucrose Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Jordi Cuadros and Tim Palucka
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Molarity, molality, mass percent, mole fraction? Understanding concentrations.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Making Solutions from solids
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Jordi Cuadros and Mike Karabinos
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Making salt solutions at different concentration.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Metals Density Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Jordi Cuadros and Tim Palucka
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Identify metals from their density.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Liquid Density Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Jordi Cuadros and Tim Palucka
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Identify a liquid from its density.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Alcohol Density Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Jordi Cuadros and Tim Palucka
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Determine the concentration from the density of the solution.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Jello Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Donovan Lange
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: In this problem, students mix together solutions in an attempt to control their color change.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Oracle Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Donovan Lange
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Limiting reagent problem to determine the stoichiometery of a reaction.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Oracle Problem 2
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Donovan Lange
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: The limiting reagent problem from above with a more challenging solution.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Textbook Style Limiting Reagents Problems
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: David Yaron and Mike Karabinos
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Solving text-book style limiting reagent problems using the virtual lab.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Open-ended Text Book Style Limiting Reagent Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: David Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Design an experiment to answer a limiting reagent style problem.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Predicting DNA concentration
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Dave Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Predict the results of a limiting reagents problem involving strings of DNA.

PROBLEM.TITLE: DNA/Dye Problem 2
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: David Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: In this limiting reagent exercise, students develop an experiment to determine the concentration of an unlabeled container.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Unknown Concentration Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Mike Karabinos
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Determine the concentration of Silver ion in a Silver Nitrate solution.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Gravimetric Determination of Arsenic
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Jordi Cuadros
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Determine the amount of arsenic present in soil samples.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Cobalt Lab
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Bob Belford
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: An experiment that looks at Cobalt(II) Complexes & LeChatlier's Principle.

PROBLEM.TITLE: DNA Binding Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Dave Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Explore equilibrium constants in biochemical systems.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Temperature and the solubility of salts
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Rob Belford and David Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Examine the solubilities of salts based on temperature.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Determining the solubility product
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Rob Belford and David Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Determine the solubility product constatnt (Ksp) for various solids.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Solubility Determination Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Dave Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Determine the solubility of CuCl at different temperatures.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Thermochemistry Problem 1
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Dave Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Observe and then determine the heat of reactions in aqueous solutions.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Coffee
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Tim Palucka and David Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Create a solution of Coffee with a desired temerpature.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Heats of Reaction - Hess' Law
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Barry Charington
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: A demonstration of Hess' Law using three reactions, the solubility of NaOH in water and in HCL and the reaction of a solution of HCL and a soluation of NaOH.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Coolant I
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Tim Palucka and Jordi Cuadros
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Measure and compare the heat capacity of an unknown liquid.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Coolant II
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Tim Palucka and David Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Measure and compare the heat capacity of an unknown liquid with an unknown density.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Camping 1
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Tim Palucka and David Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Measure the enthalpy of a reaction.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Camping 2
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Tim Palucka and David Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Determine change in the enthalpy of a reaction as the concentration of reactants are varied

PROBLEM.TITLE: Camping 3
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: David Yaron and Jordi Cuadros
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Create solutions that when mixed, increase to a certain temperature.

PROBLEM.TITLE: ATP Reaction (Thermochemistry and Bonding)
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: David Yaron and Jordi Cuadros
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Determine the enthalpy of the ATP reaction.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Strong Acid Problems
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Rea Freeland
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Text book style strong acid and base problems that can be checked using the virtual lab.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Weak Acid Problems
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Rea Freeland
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Text book style weak acid and base problems that can be checked using the virtual lab.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Method of Successive Dilutions
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Bob Belford
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Exploring the pH Scale by the method of successive dilutions.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Prelab Exercises: Acid Base Titration
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Sophia Nussbaum
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: A collection of questions and exercises to complete before performing an acid/base titration.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Standardization of NaOH
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Dave Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: In this prelab exercise, students standardize a solution of NaOH using KHP.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Unknown Acid and Base Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Dave Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: In this exercise, students graph the titration curve of an unknown acid and base to determine their pKa's and concentrations.

PROBLEM.TITLE: pKa and Weak Acid Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Dave Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Determine the pKa and concentration ratio of a protein in solution.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Buffer Creation Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Sophia Nussbaum
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: An exercise to design a buffer solution with specific properties.

PROBLEM.TITLE: DNA/Dye Problem
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Dave Yaron
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Students examine equilibrium and buffer solutions in a biological setting.

PROBLEM.TITLE: Redox Reaction Series
PROBLEM.AUTHOR: Barry Charington
PROBLEM.DESCRIPTION: Students prepare an oxidation reduction reaction series from experimental data collected in virtual lab.
